Detailed Description

Device abstraction layer for HS MMC/SD.

This file contains the device abstraction layer APIs for HS MMC/SD.

Function Documentation

void HSMMCSDBlkLenSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  blklen 
)

Set the block length/size for data transfer.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
blklenCommand to be passed to the controller/card
Note
: blklen should be within the limits specified by the controller/card
Returns
none
int32_t HSMMCSDBusFreqSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  freq_in,
uint32_t  freq_out,
uint32_t  bypass 
)

Set output bus frequency.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
freq_inThe input/ref frequency to the controller
freq_outThe required output frequency on the bus
bypassIf the reference clock is to be bypassed
Returns
0 on clock enable success -1 on clock enable fail
Note
: If the clock is set properly, the clocks are enabled to the card with the return of this function
int32_t HSMMCSDBusPower ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  pwr 
)

Turn MMC/SD bus power on / off.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
pwrpower on / off setting

pwr can take the values
HS_MMCSD_BUS_POWER_ON
HS_MMCSD_BUS_POWER_OFF

Returns
0 if the operation succeeded -1 if the operation failed
void HSMMCSDBusVoltSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  volt 
)

Configure the MMC/SD bus voltage.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
voltSD/MMC bus voltage

volt can take the values
HS_MMCSD_BUS_VOLT_1P8
HS_MMCSD_BUS_VOLT_3P0
HS_MMCSD_BUS_VOLT_3P3

Returns
None.
void HSMMCSDBusWidthSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  width 
)

Configure the MMC/SD bus width.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
widthSD/MMC bus width

width can take the values
HS_MMCSD_BUS_WIDTH_8BIT
HS_MMCSD_BUS_WIDTH_4BIT
HS_MMCSD_BUS_WIDTH_1BIT

Returns
None.
void HSMMCSDCommandSend ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  cmd,
uint32_t  cmdarg,
const void *  data,
uint32_t  nblks,
uint32_t  dmaEn 
)

Pass the MMC/SD command to the controller/card.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
cmdCommand to be passed to the controller/card
cmdargargument for the command
datadata pointer, if it is a data command, else must be null
nblksdata length in number of blocks (multiple of BLEN)
dmaEnShould dma be enabled (1) or disabled (0)
Note
: Please use HS_MMCSD_CMD(cmd, type, restype, rw) to form command
Returns
none
void HSMMCSDDataGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint8_t *  data,
uint32_t  len 
)

Send the data to the card from the conntroller.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
datapointer to buffer which is to be filled with the data
lenlength of the data
Note
: this function reads the data in chunks of 32 bits (4-byte words). Hence, the len should be multiple of 4-byte words
Returns
none
void HSMMCSDDataTimeoutSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  timeout 
)

Set data timeout value.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
timeoutthe data time out value

Timeout value is the exponential of 2, as mentioned in the controller reference manual.

Note
: Please use HS_MMCSD_DATA_TIMEOUT(n) for setting this value
13 <= n <= 27
Returns
None.
int32_t HSMMCSDInitStreamSend ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Sends INIT stream to the card.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
Returns
0 If INIT command could be initiated -1 If INIT command could not be completed/initiated
int32_t HSMMCSDIntClock ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  pwr 
)

Turn Internal clocks on / off.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
pwrclock on / off setting

pwr can take the values
HS_MMCSD_INTCLOCK_ON
HS_MMCSD_INTCLOCK_OFF

Returns
0 if the operation succeeded -1 if the operation failed
void HSMMCSDIntrEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Enables the controller events to generate a h/w interrupt request.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagSpecific event required;

flag can take the following (or combination of) values
HS_MMCSD_SIGEN_xxx

Returns
none
void HSMMCSDIntrStatusClear ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Clear the status bits from the controller.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagSpecific status required;

flag can take the following (or combination of) values
HS_MMCSD_STAT_xxx

Returns
none
void HSMMCSDIntrStatusDisable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Disables the controller events to set flags in status register.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagSpecific event required;

flag can take the following (or combination of) values
HS_MMCSD_INTR_xxx

Note
: This function only enables the reflection of events in status register. To disable events to generate a h/w interrupt request
See also
HSMMCSDIntrEnable()
Returns
none
void HSMMCSDIntrStatusEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Enables the controller events to set flags in status register.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagSpecific event required;

flag can take the following (or combination of) values
HS_MMCSD_INTR_xxx

Note
: This function only enables the reflection of events in status register. To enable events to generate a h/w interrupt request
See also
HSMMCSDIntrEnable()
Returns
none
uint32_t HSMMCSDIntrStatusGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Gets the status bits from the controller.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagSpecific status required;

flag can take the following (or combination of) values
HS_MMCSD_STAT_xxx

Returns
status flags
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsCardInserted ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check if the card is inserted and detected.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
Returns
0 if the card is not inserted and detected 1 if the card is inserted and detected
Note
: that this functional may not be available for all instances of the controler. This function, is only useful of the controller has a dedicated card detect pin. If not, the card detection mechanism is application implementation specific
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsCardWriteProtected ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check if the card is write protected.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
Returns
0 if the card is not write protected 1 if the card is write protected
Note
: that this functional may not be available for all instances of the controler. This function, is only useful of the controller has a dedicated write protect detect pin. If not, the write protect detection mechanism is application implementation specific
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsCmdComplete ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  retry 
)

Checks if the command is complete.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
retryretry times to poll for completion
Returns
1 if the command is complete 0 if the command is not complete
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsHSupported ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Check if the controller supports high speed.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
Returns
0 if high speed is not supported 1 if high speed is supported
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsIntClockStable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  retry 
)

Get the internal clock stable status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
retryretry times to poll for stable
Note
: if retry is zero the status is not polled. If it is non-zero status is polled for retry times
Returns
1 if the clock is stable 0 if the clock is not stable
uint32_t HSMMCSDIsXferComplete ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  retry 
)

Checks if the transfer is complete.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
retryretry times to poll for completion
Returns
1 if the transfer is complete 0 if the transfer is not complete
int32_t HSMMCSDLinesReset ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  flag 
)

Soft reset the MMC/SD controller lines.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
flagreset flags indicating the lines to be reset.

flag can take the following values
HS_MMCSD_DATALINE_RESET
HS_MMCSD_CMDLINE_RESET
HS_MMCSD_ALL_RESET

Returns
0 on reset success -1 on reset fail
void HSMMCSDResponseGet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t *  rsp 
)

Get the command response from the conntroller.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers
rsppointer to buffer which is to be filled with the response
Note
: that this function shall return the values from all response registers. Hence, rsp, must be a pointer to memory which can hold max response length. It is the responsibility of the caller to use only the required/relevant parts of the response
Returns
none
int32_t HSMMCSDSoftReset ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Soft reset the MMC/SD controller.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
Returns
0 on reset success -1 on reset fail
void HSMMCSDSupportedVoltSet ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  volt 
)

Set the supported voltage list.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
voltSupported bus voltage

volt can take the values (or a combination of)
HS_MMCSD_SUPPORT_VOLT_1P8
HS_MMCSD_SUPPORT_VOLT_3P0
HS_MMCSD_SUPPORT_VOLT_3P3

Returns
None.
void HSMMCSDSystemConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  config 
)

Configure the MMC/SD controller standby, idle and wakeup modes.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the MMC/SD controller Registers.
configThe standby, idle and wakeup modes

flag can take the values (or a combination of the following)
HS_MMCSD_STANDBY_xxx - Standby mode configuration
HS_MMCSD_CLOCK_xxx - Clock mode configuration
HS_MMCSD_SMARTIDLE_xxx - Smart IDLE mode configuration
HS_MMCSD_WAKEUP_xxx - Wake up configuration
HS_MMCSD_AUTOIDLE_xxx - Auto IDLE mode configuration

Returns
None.
